definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sound of sighing/(interjection expressing surprise, sorrow, regret, disappointment etc) oh/damn/wow

sentences.english: Just like platinum, its rarity gives it a whooping value.
sentences.chinese: 就像铂金，其稀有性使得它百日咳的价值。

sentences.english: Dot how the whooping cough of the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 小孩子咋么会的百日咳？

sentences.english: It is impossible to charm away the whooping-cough.
sentences.chinese: 用符咒驱除百日咳是不可能的。

sentences.english: To the cold, whooping cough, laryngitis , chronic bronchitic effective.
sentences.chinese: 对感冒，百日咳，喉炎，慢性支气管炎有效。

sentences.english: California is now in the middle of the worst outbreak of pertussis in half a century.
sentences.chinese: 加州目前正处于半个世纪以来最严重的百日咳爆发中。

sentences.english: Moreover, pertussis toxin was able to inhibit spontaneous tryptase release from colon mast cells.
sentences.chinese: 百日咳毒素还能够减少自发性类胰蛋白酶释放。

sentences.english: Children get whooping cough vaccine in a series of shots beginning at 2 months.
sentences.chinese: 儿童在2月龄开始需要接种一系列的百日咳疫苗。

sentences.english: This will prevent them from getting whooping -cough.
sentences.chinese: 这就可以防止他们染上百日咳。

sentences.english: The patient's friends with cough were treated for presumed pertussis .
sentences.chinese: 病人有咳嗽的朋友做了百日咳假定性治疗。

sentences.english: There is no specific treatment for pertussis.
sentences.chinese: 对于百日咳没有专门的治疗方法。

definition: epidemic encephalitis B (abbr. for 乙型腦炎|乙型脑炎[yi3 xing2 nao3 yan2])

pinyin: shang4 hu1 xi1 dao4 gan3 ran3
